metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24303 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
Pillow before 9.0.1 allows attackers to delete files because spaces in temporary pathnames are mishandled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 9.0.1-1build1
python3-pil.imagetk - 9.0.1-1build1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Further commits in 9.1 removed deleting the temporary files completely, not sure what the impact of using the below 3 commits are on older releases, will they introduce a regression that got fixed in 9.1?

criterions.comment: pillow package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.1-1build1').
